title: Awful
text: As a long time user this app has grown into a multi-tool of useless features added by listening to self-gratifying suggestions. Instead of learning to code or how to personalize their preferences they sent feedback to Microsoft who did it for them. But look around, can we say it‚Äôs better or an improvement to using EMAIL? I suspect this latest update furthers the work of AI, which I don‚Äôt need at all. I want Outlook to do what it has so far failed to do - improve my EMAIL service. No more junk mail, scams, phishing, and offers for dates or overseas brides. No more links with 6 lines of coding to webpages that don‚Äôt work or exist. No more video ads that block showing the content of my emails until after it‚Äôs downloaded. By the way, has anyone ever bothered to read much less purchase anything from those ads? How does unsolicited offers get my email address Microsoft after you have forced us to adopt MFA and other annoying security measures? So, 1-star because there‚Äôs nothing less.

title: Outlook is best email OS/Client
text: After using most of the mainstream email clients, I believe that Outlook is the best for work, school, or personal. The ability to customize, archive, and categorize emails as well as the various import/export functions and many other features makes it unmatched.

title: Best Microsoft app on any platform
text:
I don't always love Microsoft software. OneNote and Teams on Mac are both pretty miserable for example. But this Outlook app is among the best apps on my phone. Fast, intuitive, super reliable. Seems to use standard iOS conventions where possible, but also has creative (and again, intuitive) solutions to accomplishing feature-parity with the desktop app. One specific example is the calendar invite / scheduling functionality. It's brilliant. 

I wish more Microsoft apps on Apple platforms were done by the team responsible for this one. And no, I'm not a part of that team or know anything about it. I'm saying this genuinely.

title: Outlook 365 review
text: Outlook 365 offers a comprehensive suite of productivity tools seamlessly integrated into a user-friendly platform. Its intuitive interface makes managing emails, calendars, and contacts a breeze, whether on desktop or mobile. With advanced features like focused inbox, smart scheduling assistance, and robust search capabilities, staying organized has never been easier. The collaborative nature of Outlook 365 fosters efficient teamwork through shared calendars, files, and real-time co-authoring. Plus, its robust security measures ensure peace of mind, making it a top choice for individuals and businesses seeking a reliable and versatile email and productivity solution.

title: Great Overall, contacts could use improvements
text: Love MS office apps, outlook, and the cross functionality. Contacts could really use some native features for capturing contact information. Features like add new contact when you receive an email from someone you don‚Äôt have in a contact list. Then give the ability to better retrieve all information from the contacts signature. Features that would allow for better grouping, or categories separate from the inbox feature. This would give someone like a sales rep a better way to assign contacts to an account/location. Then provide the function to search the account name see all contacts and related emails. Provide filters to narrow down and better locate items related to a person/project. If these features would then synchronize with apps like ToDo and OneNote it would be quite powerful.
